newsitem.title: SLOVAKIA: SLOVAK CBANK CALLS FOR SPEEDIER BANKRUPTCY PROCESS.
newsitem.headline: SLOVAK CBANK CALLS FOR SPEEDIER BANKRUPTCY PROCESS.

text.p: The National Bank of Slovakia (NBS) on Friday said it supported the government's corporate revitalisation aims, calling for a speeding up bankruptcies of insolvent firms through market means.
"The NBS supports the government's aim to revitalise financial flows within the restructuring of the Slovak economy," the NBS said in a statement issued after its regular governing board meeting.
But it added that some amendments to several existing laws were crucial for creating the legislative environment needed for the strategy to materialise.

"The NBS perceives this process as a systematic solution, focused on the restructuring of selected commercial banks' loan portfolios...which will create conditions for revitalisation of perspective Slovak firms."
The NBS said it had appproved a strategy for bank restructuring, mainly through bank loan portfolio restructuring, based on last year's results which it will present to the government.

"Liquidation of unprosperous firms by speeding up bankruptcies should be a part of the process...which must be carried out mainly by market means -- especially by voluntary principles of both creditors and debtors," it said.
